TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DocumentId extends System.Object

remarks.para: Contains methods that enable or disable the capability to assign Document IDs to query Document ID feature and assignment status, and to query and set Document ID providers.
Provides methods for assigning Document Ids to documents, and provides methods to use lookup and search to get documents by their Document ID.

.method public static hidebysig void EnableAssignment(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site, bool fEnable) cil managed
Public Shared Sub EnableAssignment (site As SPSite, fEnable As Boolean)
public: static void EnableAssignment(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPSite ^ site, bool fEnable);

Docs.param: true if it enables assignment; otherwise, false
object on which to enable or disable the assignment of a object
Docs.summary: Enables or disables the ability to assign to a object.

remarks.para: This overload of the method always schedules the assignment timer job, never overwrites existing Ids,applies to all content types and sets no prefix for Ids.

Docs.exception: object or its root object properties are set to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The Document ID feature is not activated for the target object.

Docs.summary: Enables or disables objects assigned on a site.

remarks.para: Always applies to all content types, never sets a prefix for ids and allows control over scheduling and overwriting.

Docs.param: ID to search for
object to search on
Version of the label of the document for which to get the URL
Docs.summary: Finds the URL of a document with the specified value and parameter value.
Docs.returns: URL of the document as a String. a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the document is not found, or if more than one document is found

remarks.para: If there is more than one result, this method will return a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). In that case, use the method.

Docs.exception: object value is set to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Docs.param: ID to search for.
object to search on.
Docs.summary: Finds the URLs of a document and all of its versions with a specified Id.
Docs.returns: Array of strings that represents the URLs of all versions of the document found with the specified value.

remarks.para: An array of strings representing the URLs of all the versions of the document found with the specified Id. a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) and 0 length arrays mean no results were found.

Docs.exception: The object value is set to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
